Author: adstrakt#8509
Content: A question i ask myself is. If this would not work better with autogenerated names / address - so just as you load the page you are already assigned a name. Skips one step +  could solve people using duplicate names.

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content:
That is possible also yeah. But the user must also be able to input the name of his choice. If it acts like : default : generated but still selectable / editable it s also good. 
What it will allow is just "trade user name" creation. As temp addresses are generated on the fly once both side agreed on a trade

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: Cause people loading the page could also think : hmmmm what guarantees me that I got an unique address

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: Another path could be to directly generate it and have a type of choice on first screen : generate my trading pair ID, or use mine with an inputbox

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: The same applies for the validation stuff : steps 1 2 3. We can change the behaviour to skip these steps

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: The thing is they allow to be able to call the address gen right after we re sure both agreed on the trade

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: But it can be changed to be launched just after the receiver gives his addresses

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: It would remove 2 extra steps

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: So the trade remains "unconfirmed" until the receiver gives his addresses. And on that state it also allows us to delete unanswered asks for trades older than x days/minutes

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: You basically go from step 0 to 3

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: (On current version)

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: That is more user friendly as this logic will prevent one step on each side.

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: I don t know how you intend to build that part but it could also mean that only one side has to type anything. The other could just use a link with his generated username inside

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: Or basically the creator of the trade fills every info like source amount / coin and  dest amount / coin and the receiver only have to check that it matches when he launches the page

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: That would make the autogen very cool as no noone has to enter anything else than trade details and own addresses

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: The best way maybe is to just draw on paper a clean flowchart and brainstorm it here

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: As long as we have a clear trade status, like state 3 : both have validated. Step 4 : address gen ok, step 5 : sender tx ok etc... it won t be a big change on queries and such

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: I figured out rethinking about parallelization that half steps are a problem. For example step 3 atm is when both agreed and addresses are not generated. So the scripts that will handle have to query unnecessary columns. Splitting into 2 clear steps would make the inside work more fluid and focused on specific steps instead of flood of if... if...

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: Basically each step could be associated and launched in the same time than others. As there won t be overlapping in queries and scripts

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: (I planned to add extra step when address are generated, that would let me run concurrent address gen and tx check without any possible glitch.
